title: I Made It!
body:
So i finally climbed out of bronze 5.. such an achievement for me
i thought it was my team and blamed them for so long
then i started looking at myself and realized i was playing bad so i fixed a few things and climbed to Bronze 4

Im at 0 points, if i lose my first B4 match will i go back to b5 right away?

replies.body:
:( im not climbing well
i cant get the team to realise when to get objectives
like we killed 5 of them and they all go and farm jngle iunstead of pushing
We have no inhibs and they are out farming jungle instead of defending

AND i must be really bad, im gettin 12 LP a win and 21 a loss


i thought i had been improving and but if its gonna be that bad im thinking of not playing lol anymore :(
seriously 21 for a loss! 12 for a win!
and to improve my MMR it will just get ruined more by losing more games

Niiicee!!! It's awesome to see people actually realizing their own mistakes instead of blaming it on their teammates the whole time. Yes, teammates that feed can be such a pain, but it's important to focus on what you CAN control(your champion). :) 

To answer your question it will vary between 2-4 losses depending on the people you're matched up with, you definitely won't drop on your first match though! 

Congratz and gl on the climb!!:D
Congrats. It usually takes at least 4 losses as soon as you reach a new division to drop. You don't actually drop until your MMR meets the average of the divison below you though.
No, you won't drop first match. That would be stupid

Gratz u past almost like 60% of people in the server. 
{{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}}

First of All congratulations! You've started your climbing journey!

You usually will get around 2 losses on 0 lp before you drop if you've come fresh out of a division below. This does however depend on your MMR (sometimes you may get 3 losses before dropping on the 4th. I would continue playing and avoid the ladder anxiety of falling. Play your best every game and don't be overly concerned with the LP gains. Its gonna be a long grind up, but taking it on a game by game basis and focusing your energy into focusing on the things you can control and improving on them will be a great way to continue to win. 

My best tip would to be watch some informative streamers and learn from them. Ask a friend to take a look at a replay/spectate and help you out? Sometimes we cant see our own mistakes.

Good Luck!

no, usually its about 3-4 losses on 0 LP before you drop.
This is not a specific thing however, I have before dropped with 1 game loss, to about 6 losses.

Also gratz.
